recipe_name: Griddled quesadillas with BBQ beans and cheese with cherry tomato and avocado salsa
author: Andy Campbell
method: Mash avocado with lemon juice, add 1 tbsp of soured cream, and season to taste. Heat the beans with the sausage, and add the BBQ flavouring. Brush two tortillas with oil, and mark crossways on a griddle pan. Cover one tortilla with the beans and cheese and add the avocado mixture to the other tortilla, press both together. Cook in preheated oven 200C/400F/Gas 6 for about 5 minutes, until the cheese melts and binds it together. Allow to cool slightly then cut into triangles from the centre like a pizza. Garnish with cherry tomatoes, dollop of soured cream and coriander sprigs. Serve on slates or tiles.
ingredients: 1 tbsp vegetable oil,  1 pack of 15cm/6in flour tortillas,  1 tin refried beans,  1 smoked sausage, chopped,  BBQ flavouring,  1 ripe avocado,  soured cream,  1 tbsp lemon juice,  400g/14oz grated cheese (cheddar, Monterey jack, mozzarrella),  1 punnet cherry tomatoes,  salt and pepper,  sprigs of coriander
